The cellular part contains several different cell types. One of the most important and the How does the body make blood? ÔøΩÔøΩAnemia describes the condition in which the number of red blood cells or Hemoglobin in the blood is low. For this reason doctors sometimes describe someone with anemia as having a low blood count. A person who h Anemia:- What is Anemia?

label: Activity3
text: ÔøΩÔøΩFanconi anemia or FA is a rare inherited blood disorder that leads to bone marrow failure. FA is a type of aplastic anaemia that pre Fanconi Anemia ÔøΩÔøΩPernicious anemia is a condition in which the body can not make enough healthy red blood cells because it does not have enough vi Pernicious Anemia ÔøΩÔøΩSickle cell anemia is a serious disease in which the body makes sickle-shaped red blood cells. Normal red blood cells are disk-shaped and move easily through your bl Sickle Cell Anemia ÔøΩÔøΩThalassemias are inherited blood disorders which cause the body to make fewer healthy red blood cells and less hemoglobin (an iron-rich protein in red blood cells) Thalassemia ÔøΩiHemolytic anemia is a condition in which red blood cells are destroyed and removed from the bloodstream Hemolytic Anemia ÔøΩÔøΩAplastic anemia is a blood disorder in which the bodys bone marrow does not make enough new blood cells. This may result in a n Aplastic Anemia ÔøΩ3The most common form of anemia is iron deficiency Iron Deficiency Anemia ‚Ä¢ Fanconi anemia. ‚Ä¢ Pernicious anemia. ‚Ä¢ Sickle cell anemia. ‚Ä¢ Hemolytic anemia. ‚Ä¢ Aplastic anemia. ‚Ä¢ Thalassemia. ‚Ä¢ Iron deficiency anemia. label: Nonvegetrian_pro
text: Iron in eggs: 1.2 mg per 2 pcs ÔøΩÔøΩIn order to extract the most iron from an egg you need to ensure you are eating a boiled version. Moreover egg yolk has more iron than the egg whites. Approximately 2 large eggs a day are good enough to offer 1.2 mg of iro Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Eggs : Iron in chicken breast: 0.7 mg per 3.5 ounces ÔøΩÔøΩHaving only 3.5 ounces of chicken breast can offer you around 0.7 mg of iron. It is the fleshiest part of the bird and is comparatively the tastiest when cooke Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Chicken Breast: Iron in turkey: 0.7 mg per 3.5 ounces Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Turkey: Iron in pork: 0.8 mg per 3.5 ounces ÔøΩÔøΩPork especially its liver is termed to be a healthy source of iron too. One should prefer the lean cuts (loin chops sirloin roast and tenderloin) as bacon along with other fatty cuts can increase the cholesterol levels or clog the arterie Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Pork: Iron in fish: 3.5 mg per 3.5 ounces ÔøΩ.Fish is often known to be very rich in Omega Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Fish: Iron in ground beef: 2.1 mg per 3.5 ounces ÔøΩÔøΩMake sure you eat red meat that is fat free. It will act as a great source of iron and can drastically impact the iron levels. For instance 3 ounces of ground beef that is fat free offers around 2.1 mg of iro Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Ground beef: Iron in oysters: 3.5 mg per 3.5 ounces ÔøΩÔøΩSeafood as a whole is a rich source of iron. Oysters being one the best sources can help in losing weight and offering protection from several other diseases. Coming under the same category you may eat mussels prawns and clams to Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Oysters: Iron in chicken liver: 3.5 mg per 3.5 ounces ÔøΩIFor the meat lovers chicken liver is supposed to be a powerhouse for i Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Chicken Liver: Best Non Vegetarian ironrich foods PRO Features

label: Activity4
text: Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips ‚Ä¢ enlargement of the spleen with certain causes of anemia. ‚Ä¢ yellow skin called jaundice if anemia is due to red blood cell breakdown. ‚Ä¢ pale or cold skin. ÔøΩÔøΩ‚Ä¢ Change in stool color including black and tarry stools (sticky and foul smelling) maroon-colored or visibly bloody stools if the anemia is due to blood loss through the gastrointestinal tr Some of the signs that may indicate anemia in an individual may include: ‚Ä¢ rapid heart rate ‚Ä¢ fainting or passing out ‚Ä¢ dizziness ‚Ä¢ chest pain angina or heart attack Symptoms of severe anemia may include: ‚Ä¢ looking pale. ‚Ä¢ palpitations (feeling of the heart racing or beating irregularly) ‚Ä¢ lightheadedness ‚Ä¢ shortness of breath ‚Ä¢ weakness ‚Ä¢ decreased energy ‚Ä¢ Fatigue Symptoms of anemia may include the following: ÔøΩÔøΩBecause a low red blood cell count decreases oxygen delivery to every tissue in the body anemia can cause a variety of signs and symptoms. It can also worsen the symptoms of almost a Anemia Symptoms

text: High Fevers are also main cause of reducing platelets count. Fever When the bone marrow stops making enough new blood cells called aplastic anemia it causes a low platelet count. Aplastic anemia ÔøΩÔøΩLeukemia or lymphoma directly damage bone marrow and destroy blood stem cells but also most common cancer treatments (radiation and chemotherapy) destroy stem cell even mor Cancer ÔøΩÔøΩCertain conditions that run in families and are inherited cause low platelet counts including Wiskott-Aldrich and May-Hegglin syndrome Genetics ÔøΩSomet Pregnancy ÔøΩÔøΩChemicals commonly found in the environment including pesticides arsenic and benzene can all slow the production of platelet Toxin exposure from the environment ÔøΩpRarely severe bacterial infections involving the blood cause a pause in platelet production. Viruses that can Infection and Viruses ÔøΩÔøΩCertain nutrients are needed to make enough platelets including iron vitamin B12 and folate. Being deficient in these nutrien Poor diet and nutrient deficiencies ÔøΩÔøΩAlcohol slows the production of platelets and is the biggest problem when it‚Äôs consumed excessively especially if someone‚Äôs diet is also low in nutr Alchol ÔøΩÔøΩDiseases like lupus and rheumatoid arthritis cause the immune system to mistakenly attack and destroys platelets. This is called immune thrombocytopenia or IT Autoimmune diseases ÔøΩÔøΩThe spleen helps fight infections and clean the blood so illnesses that cause an enlarged spleen can cause too many platelets to be Reactions to medications and over-the-counter drugs ÔøΩÔøΩPlatelet production can be altered due to the use of drugs including diuretics NSAID anti-inflammatory drugs and antibiotics or frequently taking common painkillers like ibuprofen and aspiri Reactions to medications and over-the-counter drugs ÔøΩÔøΩThe spleen helps fight infections and clean the blood so illnesses that cause an enlarged spleen can cause too many platelets to be Enlarged Spleen Some of the most common underlying reasons for alternations in normal blood platelet counts include: Low Platelet Count Causes (Thrombocytopenia) ÔøΩ:A low platelet count is a blood disorder that has a long Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips Low Platelets Count

label: Activity7
text: Anemia Care Foods & Diet Tips ÔøΩÔøΩFoods that should be avoided by those with anemia are those that interfere with the absorption of iron or cause iron depletion. They include drinks such as coffee and tea and foods such as bran egg whites white bread sugar and dessert Foods to Avoid : ÔøΩÔøΩDo not consume iron supplements along with calcium supplements and antibiotics.It can be consumed along with multivitamins. Such as Vitamin BC. It is good to consume iron tablets with fruit juices Such as orange juice etc for the better absorptio Drug Instructions : ‚Ä¢ Beans ‚Ä¢ Sunflower seeds ‚Ä¢ Soybeans ‚Ä¢ Brown rice ‚Ä¢ Whole wheat Other foods that are rich in iron include : ‚Ä¢ Beetroots ‚Ä¢ Carrots ‚Ä¢ Squash ‚Ä¢ Green onions ‚Ä¢ Spinach Vegetables that form part of an anemia diet include : ‚Ä¢ Apricots ‚Ä¢ Dark grapes ‚Ä¢ Pears ‚Ä¢ Apples ‚Ä¢ Bananas Fruits that should form part of an anemia diet include : ÔøΩÔøΩFoods to eat in an anemia diet should include fruits vegetables herbs seeds nuts and meat that are rich in iron vitamin B12 folic acid and vitamin Foods to Include : ÔøΩYThe first five days of a special diet for anemic patients should be devoted exclusivel Diet Chart for Anemic Patient : ÔøΩÔøΩAnemia is caused by low levels of hemoglobin in the blood which is in turn caused by low levels of iron or vitamin B12 in the body. Refined foods such as white bread sugar and desserts can deplete the body of iron unless iron rich f Anemia Diet : Anemia Diet

label: DisplayActivity
text: * Remember there is no easy way to lose weight so set a goal and encourage yourself.* Generally obese people are more prone to be attacked by serious diseases like BP cardiac problems diabetes etc so get your health check up done to figure out if everything else is well with you.* Strictly follow no fat and very low calorie diet plan.* Exercise is must though it is very difficult to move your body in particular manner because of excess fat but once you start doing it your body itself become habitual to it. So do workout daily.* No sugar and very low salt is recommended.* Try to consume only heart healthy oils e.g. omega 3 MUFA & PUFA rich oils.* Drink lots and lots of liquids including water tender coconut water lime water etc.* Eat raw boiled or baked vegetables; add more of leafy vegetables beans broccoli etc in your diet.* Include apple oranges papaya melons and guava in your diet.* Minimize the amount of salt intake to enhance the taste of food use roasted cumin seed powder black pepper powder lemon juice mint and other herbs.* A strict no to all junk food bottled and packaged drinks & beverages shakes sauces refined wheat flour preparations chips chocolates pickles sweets.* Use wholegrain pulses and cereals. Tips For You Should Be Done Under Adult SuperVision Should Be Done Under Adult SuperVision Should Be Done Under Adult SuperVision Should Be Done Under Adult SuperVision Should Be Done Under Adult SuperVision Should Be Done Under Adult SuperVision Your BMI should be: Your current BMI is your ideal weight should be lb) kg ( inch)and age ).cm ( lbs).As per your height Your current weight is ft kg ( and Gender ( Underweight Ideal Weight BMI Calculator

text: ÔøΩ ‚Ä¢ Apples ‚Ä¢ Banana ‚Ä¢ Almonds ‚Ä¢ Carrots ‚Ä¢ Mangoes ‚Ä¢ Red meats ‚Ä¢ Poultry ‚Ä¢ Fennel ‚Ä¢ Sunflower seeds ‚Ä¢ Flax seeds ‚Ä¢ Red Grapes ‚Ä¢ Strawberries ‚Ä¢ Raisins ‚Ä¢ prunes ‚Ä¢ Peaches Foods to Eat PRO Features ÔøΩÔøΩ Sun Salutation:Sun Salutation not only stretches your spine and joints but also works to regulate your breathing calm your mind and energize your body. Stick Pose:This pose is believed to increase the height of the user. This yoga is good Yoga Poses forHealing Anemia PRO Features ÔøΩ‚Ä¢ Eat a Healthy Diet that Includes Good Sources of Iron. ‚Ä¢ Include vitamin C rich foods and drinks in your diet to increase the absorption of iron. ‚Ä¢ Never eat calcium rich foods along with iron rich ones as calcium interferes w Tips to Prevent Anemia PRO Features ‚Ä¢ Beans and amaranth mix Pulse‚Ä¢ Broccoli and cottage cheese vegetable‚Ä¢ Yogurt (curd)‚Ä¢ Chapatti ‚Ä¢ Tomato rice ‚Ä¢ Lemonade‚Ä¢ Green gram sprouts with chopped tomatoes and onionsOR ‚Ä¢ Bulgur wheat pancakes ÔøΩÔøΩ‚Ä¢ Chapattis made from coarse flour‚Ä¢ Mixed whole Pulse‚Ä¢ Rice cooked‚Ä¢ Fenugreek potato vegetable‚Ä¢ Salad (lettuce tomato onion lemon)‚Ä¢ Pome ‚Ä¢ Dried fruits and Nuts‚Ä¢ Carrot beetroot & tomato Soup ÔøΩÔøΩ ‚Ä¢ Orange Juice with vegetable rice flakes(poha) OR ‚Ä¢ Stewed Prunes ‚Ä¢ Fortified cereal with Milk OR ‚Ä¢ Multigrain bread toast with tomato & spinach spread ‚Ä¢ Mix Diet plan for Patient having Anemia PRO Features ÔøΩ/ Iron inhibitors or foods Foods to Avoid PRO Features ÔøΩ{‚Ä¢ Anemia caused by blood loss. ‚Ä¢ Anemia caused by decreased or faulty red blood cell production Causes of Anemia PRO Features ÔøΩAppleApple can Home Remedies for Anemia PRO Features ÔøΩ{‚Ä¢ A diet lacking in certain vitaminsA diet consistently low in iron vitamin B-12 and folic acid inc Risk Factors ofAnemia PRO Features
